intro: Marsdenia speciosa, commonly known as the showy Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pinkish flowers, which are often followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
